title: GCHQ stops criminals using millions of stolen credit card details
text:
The UK’s security services have revealed details of a previously secret operation to block criminals from making fraudulent purchases using stolen credit card information.

The National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC), a division of spy agency GCHQ, said Operation Haulster has stopped millions of pounds being stolen from families by hackers.

The scheme automatically flagged details of more than 1m stolen credit cards to banks, the NCSC said.

Online criminals frequently sell and trade vast sets of stolen card information online using hidden marketplaces on the so-called Dark Web. These can be used to steal individuals' identities and make purchases using their credentials.

The NCSC’s Operation Haulster...
description: The UK’s security services have revealed details of a previously secret operation to block criminals from making fraudulent purchases using stolen credit card information.
